channel.title: [VB '08] Char Array to String
channel.description:
Is there a quick way to convert a char array to a string? I am pretty new to Visual Basic, and I don't know if there is an easy way.
Also, I am making a brute forcer for a project. The char array is the password. How do I get the loop to increase the previous letter after a - z? So far, I have [code=vb] For s As Integer = 5 To 20 For i As Integer = 1 To 37 Password(s) = Chars(i) Attempt = Attempt + 1 txtHTML.Text = HTML strPass = Convert.ToString(Password) 'This line is trouble. strPass comes out literally as "System.String[]" Next Next [/code]
I left out some code like the actual testing, but this is the basics of it. Am I doing something wrong, or is there an easier/quicker way?

item.title: [VB '08] Char Array to String
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

Is there a quick way to convert a char array to a string? I am pretty new to Visual Basic, and I donâ€™t know if there is an easy way.

Also, I am making a brute forcer for a project. The char array is the password. How do I get the loop to increase the previous letter after a - z? So far, I have

        For s As Integer = 5 To 20
            For i As Integer = 1 To 37
                Password(s) = Chars(i)
                Attempt = Attempt + 1
                txtHTML.Text = HTML
                strPass = Convert.ToString(Password) 'This line is trouble. strPass comes out literally as "System.String[]"
            Next
        Next

I left out some code like the actual testing, but this is the basics of it. Am I doing something wrong, or is there an easier/quicker way?
